meanings.definition: Actively break the terms of (a law, agreement, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He knowingly infringed the rules by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The company infringed on the copyright of the artist by using their work without permission.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel infringed on the bird feeder, causing chaos among the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter infringed on the solemn atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's spray paint infringed on the blank wall, transforming it into a colorful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Act so as to limit or undermine (something)
meanings.sent1: The new policy inadvertently infringed on the employees' freedom to choose their work hours.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site infringed on the residents' ability to relax at home.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon infringed on the picnic by stealing all the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds infringed on the sunny day, casting a shadow over the park.
meanings.sent5: The overgrown vines infringed on the path, making it difficult to walk through the forest.
